message: Using `failwith` (or `assert false`) usually is a clue that a corner case is not being handled properly. To report errors we recommend using error monad instead. In princliple, these construction are OK for temporary work-in-progress code, but in release they should be eliminated

First item in file should be a documentation comment with copyright information. For example:
            (** Copyright 2021-2022, Winnie Pooh et al. *)
OCaml files should provide license information in second line (structure item)
